treatment.reference: Methanocella arvoryzae sp. nov., a hydrogenotrophic methanogen isolated from rice field soil IJSEM 60:2918-2923
treatment.description: Cells occur singly and most are rod-shaped. Coccoid cells are also observed, especially in late-exponential phase cultures. Methane is produced from H2/CO2 and formate. Acetate is required for growth and yeast extract enhances growth. Acetate, 1-propanol, 2-propanol, ethanol, 1-butanol, 2-butanol, cyclopentanol, methanol, methylamine, trimethylamine, and dimethylamine did not support growth or methane production. Growth occurs at 37–55 ˚C (optimum 45 ˚C), at pH 6–7.8 (optimum pH 7.0) and in the presence of NaCl concentrations below 20 g per liter. The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 56.7 mol% (HPLC). The type strain, MRE50T (=NBRC 105507T =DSM 22066T), was isolated from a thermophilic methanogenic consortium, which was originally established from a rice field soil in Italy.
